messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] New Files
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/23/03 9:22:24 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Yes, you can do that, or save the file to your own computer.  It will open in your word
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/23/03 9:22:24 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
fetteroll@... writes:

> suspect it was a formatting problem that Yahoo can't handle.
>
> What would work is to copy and paste the contents of each file into a word
> processor. That should wrap the paragraphs properly.
>
> Joyce
>

Yes, you can do that, or save the file to your own computer. It will open in
your word processor and you can read it fine.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] New Files
messages.msgSnippet: ... Tory, I suspect it was a formatting problem that Yahoo can t handle. What would work is to copy and paste the contents of each file into a word processor.
messages.messageBody:
on 7/21/03 7:37 PM, moonstarshooter at torywalk@... wrote:

> Does anyone know if there is a way to adjust my screen or the new
> files so that you don't have to scroll so far to the right to be able
> to read each line?
>

Tory,

I suspect it was a formatting problem that Yahoo can't handle.

What would work is to copy and paste the contents of each file into a word
processor. That should wrap the paragraphs properly.

Joyce

messages.subject: New Files
messages.msgSnippet: Does anyone know if there is a way to adjust my screen or the new files so that you don t have to scroll so far to the right to be able to read each line? I
messages.messageBody:
Does anyone know if there is a way to adjust my screen or the new
files so that you don't have to scroll so far to the right to be able
to read each line?

I would like to read some of the information posted, but it makes my
eyes go wacko to try to read wide posts like that.

Thanks,
Tory
